alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Eastern Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 8:03PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Isolated strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Cumberland, Nottoway, southern Goochland, northwestern Hanover, northwestern Dinwiddie, Powhatan, western Chesterfield, central Mecklenburg, Lunenburg, northwestern Henrico, southwestern Caroline, Amelia and northwestern Brunswick Counties and the City of Richmond through 900 PM EST... At 802 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Trenholm to near Burkeville to near Clarksville. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Crewe, Jetersville and Trenholm around 810 PM EST. Goochland around 815 PM EST. Chase City, Amelia Courthouse, Boydton, Oilville and Scotts Fork around 820 PM EST. Chula around 825 PM EST. Moseley, Montpelier and Wyndham around 830 PM EST. South Hill around 840 PM EST. Kenbridge and Manakin around 845 PM EST. University Of Richmond, Bon Air, Tuckahoe and Dundas around 850 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bacons Fork, North Wellville, Wilburn, Arvins Store, Ammon, Murdocks, Maidens, Gum Tree, Three Square and Nutbush. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
